Royal Museums Greenwich holds over 2.5 million items, including astronomical and navigational instruments, ship models and plans, coins, medals and flags, uniforms and weapons, plus historical art, film and photography. The National Maritime Museum also contains the world\'s largest maritime library and archive collection.
Cutty Sark, the celebrated historic sailing ship and fastest of its time. Now an award-winning visitor attraction in Greenwich, London.
The observatory was commissioned in 1675 by King Charles II. It is the home of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), the Prime Meridian of the world
A former royal residence built between 1616. Home to an internationally renowned art collection , Inigo Jones\’ architectural masterpiece is the first Classical building in the UK.
Ranger\’s House is an elegant Georgian villa on the boundary of Greenwich Park and Blackheath which houses The Wernher Collection, a world-class art collection amassed by the 19th-century businessman, Sir Julius Wernher.
The Old Royal Naval College is the architectural centrepiece of Maritime Greenwich, built between 1696 and 1712, a World Heritage Site described UNESCO as being of \"outstanding universal value\" and reckoned to be the \"finest and most dramatically sited architectural and landscape ensemble in the British Isles\".
Join Royal Observatory astronomers and leading scientists on a fascinating journey into space, from planetarium shows and science sessions for kids to in-depth astronomy courses and community events.
about_painted
The Painted Hall is a true masterpiece, boasting one of the most spectacular Baroque interiors in Europe. The extraordinary ceiling and wall decorations were conceived and executed by British artist Sir James Thornhill. The epic painting scheme, known as \‘Britain\’s Sistine Chapel\’ took nineteen years from the start of the commission to its completion in 1726.
A meridian is a north-south line, selected as the zero reference line for astronomical observations. By comparing thousands of observations taken from the same meridian it\'s possible to build up an accurate map of the sky
St Alfege Church begins in 1012, when Danish warriors killed a hostage they had taken during their raid on Canterbury. The murder of Alfege, Archbishop of Canterbury, here in Greenwich led to the building of the first church. the medieval church was replaced in 1718.

The hotel is surrounded by must-see attractions like the Cutty Sark and beautiful Greenwich Park. A stone\'s throw from Greenwich Station and the DLR, it\'s also ideal for exploring the city centre.
the stylish elegance of the Novotel London Greenwich hotel, which features bright, spacious bedrooms and colourful artwork throughout. Neighbouring Greenwich tube station, the 4-star hotel is a great choice for travellers interested in live music, riverside walks and nightlife. This modern hotel offers private on-site parking and boasts a fitness centre, a stylish restaurant, and spacious bedrooms.
TThe Birds Nest has evolved into a fantastic, international music and arts venue while retaining its original South London flavour. Located at the end of Creekside and on the borders of Greenwich and Deptford
Conveniently located near the Thames in the heart of the world heritage site of Greenwich, The Mitre should be your first port of call if you’re looking for the best value accommodation in central London, without compromising on comfort or style
Relax with a drink in our stylish 24hr lobby bar, stay connected with free fibre Wi-Fi throughout the building, and tuck into a filling breakfast (cooked breakfast with several options or a fresh continental spread - the choice is yours) each morning at the linked Café Rouge. ibis London Greenwich merges a great location with all the necessary comforts, so that you enjoy a relaxing break at budget-friendly prices.
Our 1940s hotel was once a police headquarters. Today, our RIBA-award winning building fuses history with contemporary design. Deptford Bridge Station is within streets, and we’re a mile from the National Maritime Museum, Cutty Sark, and the Royal Observatory. We serve afternoon tea, and every stay begins with a warm chocolate chip cookie.
Located a short walk from Greenwich station and the DLR train line, staying in Greenwich gives guests the opportunity to enjoy the peaceful charm of the historic area combined with fast links to London’s fast-paced action in the city centre. London Bridge can be reached in just 10 minutes.
Amazing hotel with free, superfast Wi-Fi with a maximum bandwidth of 1Gb is available throughout the venue.
A bustling south of the river spot, with great links to central London and Canary Wharf. Walking from Lewisham Station
With uninterrupted views of Blackheath towards Royal Greenwich Park, this Georgian Hotel is both grand and welcoming with its relaxed yet efficient style.

The Goddard\’s Pie and Mash business was founded in 1890 by Alfred Goddard in Evelyn Street, Deptford, London. Pies have been the staple diet of Londoners for centuries and the London ‘pie and mash’ shops offer a meal that is steeped in history and ingrained in the very fabric of London.
Fresh handmade pizza made to your personal specification in a timely manner. Any size you want, any topping your heart desires and with any sides too. You can eat in with us or order for takeaway. Whatever you.
We are located in Greenwich Market on Thursday till Sunday. All are food is fresh and made from the fresh and the highest quality. Are food with made with love and a passion that you will enjoy and want more.
We are located in Greenwich Market on Thursday till Sunday. All are food is fresh and made from the fresh and the highest quality. Are food with made with love and a passion that you will enjoy and want more.
The beautifully designed Gallery curves gracefully around our on-site kitchen and our sofa area – the perfect spot for a time-out with a nice hot drink or a glass of wine in the evening. We prepare all of our meals and snacks from carefully sourced food, including plenty of British produce. We serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.
McDonald\'s is Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers, fries, shakes and ice creams. Are food is always fresh, tasty and great value for money. You can eat in as we have seating upstairs as well as down stairs. You can also get takeaway if you want.
Located a short walk from Greenwich station and the DLR train line, and next to the Cutty Sark ship. We are on the bank of the river and have amazing views in our seating areas. We have both indoor and outside side seat. Our food is freshly made and great tasting.
You\'ll find the recently refurbished Pavilion Café at the top of the hill by the Royal Observatory. Built in 1906 this octagonal building is topped by a dove-cot with a weather vane showing Nelson looking through his telescope. In fine weather make the most of the large garden at the front and rear. In the winter, the Pavilion Café is a cosy, welcoming place to visit.
Located in the heart of the astronomy buildings in the Royal observatory at Greenwich. While you are seeing the sights and history there come in, have a rest, a bite to eat and something to drink. We have a wide range of foods and drinks for you to select.
We\'re open for Dine-in, Order and Collect via the app or for Delivery! Since 2001, Gourmet Burger Kitchen has been serving up unique flavour combinations between 2 buns (or without the bun, if you like). Ask for it rare or well done or however you want it! Also try one of our mind-meltingly good milkshakes made with real ice cream

TCombining the best in British pub hospitality with individuality, character and quirky charm, The Gipsy Moth is a Grade I listed pub at the thriving centre of Greenwich. Within view of the famous Cutty Sark, The Gipsy Moth is the perfect setting for a laid-back yet distinctly memorable drinking and dining experience. The Gipsy Moth offers flavoursome food, an explorative drinks menu and an authentic, homely atmosphere to suit all occasions.
Sat on the banks of the Thames at Ballast Quay, The Cutty Sark has welcomed guests to Greenwich for over two hundred years. We are proud to be part of this long-standing tradition of serving the very best of premium British produce in all of our seasonal dishes, accompanied by fine wines around the world and locally great real ales to pair with your tasty meal.
A historic landmark, where the past lives on in the present. Built on the site of The Old George Inn in 1837, the year of Queen Victoria’s ascension to the throne, this Grade II-listed building has taken many forms. Through Victoria’s reign it was frequented by Charles Dickens who chose the Trafalgar Tavern as the setting for the wedding breakfast in Our Mutual Friend, his final novel.
At the corner of the market, centrally located in the heart of Greenwich, The Admiral Hardy is your ideal British local, catering to families, tourist and students alike. With craft beer, real ale and mouthwatering fish and chips we are sure to have something for everyone.
Located on the historic Royal Hill, a stone\’s throw away from the centre of Greenwich, and only 400m from Greenwich DLR station. The Richard the First is proud to have been at the heart of the local community since 1923.
The Mitre is a Grade II listed public house built around 1840 located in the centre of Greenwich. It is a beautiful traditional pub with inside and outside seating. We have a wide selection of beers ales wines and spirits.
A JD Wetherspoon\'s pub located next to the Cutty Sark DLR station and the heart of Greenwich. We have a wide selection beers ales wines and spirits and unbelievable cheap prices. Are food is tasty and great value for money.
The Coach and Horses is situated slap bang in the centre of Greenwich\’s famous market, just around the corner from such as the Cutty Sark, the National Maritime Museum and the Royal Observatory. Steeped in royal history, we’re a popular pub for shoppers and tourists alike since 1780.
Just a short stroll away from the Cutty Sark, Greenwich Observatory and the National Maritime Museum, The Sail Loft makes the perfect lunch stop on the tourist trail. The famous Greenwich Market is close at hand too. We have a wide selection of beers ales wines and spirits.
Pub lunches, date nights and after work drinks, it\’s been a year of lost moments. So, say goodbye to the video calls, catch up TV and loungewear. Dig out those glad rags because it\’s nearly time to raise a glass, together at last!
